utterance.speaker: EMCEE
utterance.content: Ladies and gentlemen, the moment is almost upon us. As world-renowned trainer Francisco Pilar takes one last look at the finalists, only one question remains: Who will be this year’s Best in Show?

utterance.speaker: REPORTER
utterance.content: I’m here in the audience with reality star Kay Cappuccio and her manager and boyfriend Reggie Star. Kay, when are you and Reggie getting married?

utterance.speaker: KAY CAPPUCCIO
utterance.content: Oh …

utterance.speaker: REGGIE
utterance.content: Um…

utterance.speaker: REPORTER
utterance.content: Will it happen on the show?

utterance.speaker: KAY
utterance.content: I just want to say hi to all my fans out there and remind them that next month my new scent hits stores. Kay Cappuccio’s Guilty Pleasure. Make sure he’s guilty - of wanting you.

utterance.speaker: EMCEE
utterance.content: Francisco is ready to reveal his decision.

utterance.speaker: FRANCISCO
utterance.content: One. Two. Three.

utterance.speaker: EMCEE
utterance.content: And there you have it, folks. This year’s Sunfair Kennel Best in Show is the one, the only –

utterance.speaker: RICHARD CASTLE
utterance.content: Buttons?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You have a friend named Buttons? A human friend?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS CASTLE
utterance.content: Her mom called her that when she was little and it stuck.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And now so is she.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Buttons and I bonded over being rejected from Stanford. In fact, we applied to a lot of the same schools, so we were planning on visiting a few campuses together this weekend. Make a road trip out of it.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Whoa. Okay, whoa. Where are you staying, who’s driving, who’s chaperoning?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: We were going to take your Ferrari and hook up with some boys we met on Craigslist.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Not cool.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA RODGERS
utterance.content: Honey, don’t be suck a killjoy. I’m sure Buttons’ mother is going along.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: She is. And she’s very responsible.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, except when it comes to picking nicknames.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Look, if you want, I can have Mrs. Dutton stop by to meet you when she picks me up.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, I think that’d be ok- Her last name is Dutton? Her name is Buttons Dutton?

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: That is unfortunate.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: What’s so wrong with that?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, c’mon. That’d be like calling me Wrassel. Or Tassel or No Hassle Castle. Hey. No, I was just making a point. Please don’t call me that.

utterance.speaker: JAVIER ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Victim is Francisco Pilar. We found him here in his dressing room. He still had cash on him, plus his wallet, phone, and key card of some kind.

utterance.speaker: KATE BECKETT
utterance.content: Is the cause of death what it looks like?

utterance.speaker: LANIE PARISH
utterance.content: Yep. Someone put a leash around his neck and pulled.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Do you guys have an estimated time of death?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: We put together a window –

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Excuse me. You’re doing my job now? I didn’t know you went to medical school. But go ahead, Dr. Esposito.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Okay. Last guy to see Francisco alive left this room at 5:15, to go get him some dinner. And Mr. Green found him like this 20 minutes later.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay. Thanks.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hi.

utterance.speaker: ADAM GREEN
utterance.content: Hi. Adam Green. I’m the Sunfair Show organizer.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mr. Green, how well did you know our victim Francisco?

utterance.speaker: GREEN
utterance.content: Uh, Francisco’s been our judge for almost two decades. No one cared about dogs more than he did.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Did he have any family that we could talk to?

utterance.speaker: GREEN
utterance.content: Royal was his family.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, that’s a handsome pooch.

utterance.speaker: GREEN
utterance.content: Francisco loved him very much. Truth is, he got along better with dogs than their owners.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So dog whisperer, check. People whisperer, not so much.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Uh, did he have any problems with any of the owners?

utterance.speaker: GREEN
utterance.content: What are you suggesting?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Just that he was killed about a half an hour after he gave out Best In Show.

utterance.speaker: GREEN
utterance.content: I’ll admit that show dog owners can be passionate people. But not to this extent.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Somebody wrapped that leash around his neck.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We’ll need a list of the names of all of the contestants, along with anyone that might have had access to this room.

utterance.speaker: GREEN
utterance.content: Of course.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Is this Francisco Pilar’s dog?

utterance.speaker: GREEN
utterance.content: Yes, that’s Royal. We thought it best to keep him out of the room.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Why is he doing that?

utterance.speaker: GREEN
utterance.content: He was doing the same thing by the body when we found him. Maybe some sort of grieving process? I’ll get you that list of names.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So, the dog was at the crime scene at the time of the murder.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What do you want us to do, bring him in for questioning?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’m just saying – would man’s best friend just stand idly by while his master was attacked?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And if he did intervene, maybe he got DNA or trace evidence on him that could lead to our killer.

utterance.speaker: KEVIN RYAN
utterance.content: May have a lead of my own. One of the losing contestants just filed this appeal of Francisco’s decision. A guy named David Hernand. Said he was so angry the vein in his forehead was visibly throbbing. Apparently dog shows are this guy’s whole life.

utterance.speaker: DAVID HERNAND
utterance.content: Was I upset about Francisco’s death? Sure. I was more upset about his choice for Best In Show. Hey, that ribbon belonged to my Max.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mr. Hernand, can you account for your whereabouts between 5:15 and 5:35?

utterance.speaker: HERNAND
utterance.content: Yeah, I was right here at my grooming station filing my appeal – oh look, I didn’t kill him, okay? Given everything he was into, I’d say he brought it on himself.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And what exactly was he into?

utterance.speaker: HERNAND
utterance.content: Well, rumor has it he was on the take.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Are you saying he was taking bribes to fix dog shows?

utterance.speaker: HERNAND
utterance.content: Betting on dog shows? It’s a big business. And he was seeing some pretty shady characters. People with ties to Vegas.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That’s a serious allegation. Do you have any proof to back it up?

utterance.speaker: HERNAND
utterance.content: You want proof? That’s who Francisco selected Best In Show.

utterance.speaker: HERNAND
utterance.content: Just look at that mutt. Now back to my Max. Now the mutt. That’s all the proof I need.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Really? There’s big money riding on dog shows?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It’s actually kind of ingenious. You know, everyone’s got football, basketball, horse racing under a microscope looking for the slightest hint of impropriety. Who’s looking at dog shows?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I’m going to have Ryan look into it, along with Hernand’s alibi.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Whatever you’re talking about, it can wait. Ma’am, please tell Detective Beckett what you told me.

utterance.speaker: KELLY GUNTHER
utterance.content: I was backstage after the show when I saw a woman leave Francisco’s dressing room.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Can you describe her?

utterance.speaker: KELLY
utterance.content: Even better. I took a video with my phone. She was wearing a hood and sunglasses, but I recognized her instantly. It was Kay Cappuccio.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: The reality television star?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Check the time stamp. Right in the middle of our time of death window.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Here’s what I don’t get. Why would Kay Cappuccio want to kill Francisco Pilar?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Here’s what I don’t get. How does this woman have her own perfume line, an army of paparazzi outside her apartment, millions of Twitter followers, dozens of magazine covers, all with no discernable talent to account for it?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Even more perplexing? Why in almost every photo is she posed like this?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh guys, sorry. No time for photos. Okay, maybe just one.

utterance.speaker: PAPARAZZO
utterance.content: Hey, that’s not Jason Bateman.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That’s getting old.

utterance.speaker: REGGIE
utterance.content: Oh, you two must be the softer people, right?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Actually, no. We are NYPD. We are here to speak with Kay Cappuccio.

utterance.speaker: REGGIE
utterance.content: Oh, my bad. Uh, why don’t you just grab a squat right over there.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Excuse me?

utterance.speaker: REGGIE
utterance.content: Phoebe will bring you a goji berry juice.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You know what? I think I have a better idea. Everybody, take five.

utterance.speaker: REGGIE
utterance.content: Whoa, hold on a second. Kay Cappuccio doesn’t have five to spare.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: How about 15 to 20? And that goji berry juice sounds delightful.

utterance.speaker: KAY
utterance.content: Sure, I knew Francisco. I hired him to do two weeks of behavior training with my dog. Our show is going to start shooting again soon and Lolita has some minor aggression issues I wanted taken care of.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: This little charmer? I find it hard to believe –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I assume you asked for your money back?

utterance.speaker: KAY
utterance.content: I never paid him. He brought her back yesterday morning after just a few days. Said he didn’t want to work with me. So are we done here? Because I have fittings, a couple endorsement meetings, like … three red carpets I have to show up at…

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And I’ve got a witness that places you at the murder scene. So sit down.

utterance.speaker: KAY
utterance.content: Sure.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Now why did you go to see Francisco after the dog show last night?

utterance.speaker: KAY
utterance.content: I wanted an explanation as to why he wouldn’t train Lolita.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And what did he tell you?

utterance.speaker: KAY
utterance.content: I would so much rather not go into it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We’ve got a video of you leaving Francisco’s dressing room right around the time of the murder. So not going into it is not an option.

utterance.speaker: KAY
utterance.content: Fine. We didn’t talk about anything because he was already dead.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You found the body?

utterance.speaker: KAY
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And you didn’t call 911?

utterance.speaker: KAY
utterance.content: No, I did. As soon as I got into the limo.

utterance.speaker: KAY
utterance.content: No harm no foul, right?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You fled a crime scene.

utterance.speaker: KAY
utterance.content: All right. Have you heard the phrase ‘there’s no such thing as bad press’? Having your picture taken with a dead guy is the exception. I have to be so careful with my image. My image is all that I have.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, no. We were just talking about that.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Ms. Cappuccio, when Francisco brought your dog back, was he acting unusual at all?

utterance.speaker: KAY
utterance.content: Oh, I didn’t see him. He showed up in the middle of my 10AM workout.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: I was here, so I took Lolita. But you’re right. The guy was acting weird. He kept saying ‘who is she working for? I know she’s working for somebody.’. He seemed really paranoid.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Do you have any idea what he was talking about?

utterance.speaker: KAY
utterance.content: No clue. That’s why I went to go talk with him.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay. I guess then we are done. For now. Just uh … stay available for questioning.

utterance.speaker: KAY
utterance.content: Oh my God, like I’m gonna go anywhere? I can’t take one step without a million people taking my picture.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, it’s no mystery why someone wouldn’t want to be in business with Kay, but why did Francisco think she was working for someone?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Especially since her whole life is about not working. And what made him so paranoid about her?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Maybe he had something to hide. Looks like there might be some truth to those rumors that the fix was in.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah, I’ve been going to Francisco’s financials. He made a bunch of cash deposits over the last year. Ten grand a pop. So we went back and looked at the last few shows he judged. Our boy had a thing for long shots.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: The line in Vegas on yesterday’s Sunfair winner was 50 to 1. A real underdog.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What doesn’t make any sense is if he was taking the bribes, why would they kill him?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Maybe he wanted out. Or more money.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: His calendar said he had weekly appointments with a therapist, Dr. Patty Barker. They had a session the day he died. Maybe she can fill in some gaps.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay. Let’s bring her in.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: All right.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Brought you guys a little visitor.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, look who it is!

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Okay, adorable. We swabbed his mouth for human DNA but I don’t have high hopes. Even if there were some, all that slobbering - it’s probably long gone.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hey, what are we going to do with Royal? I mean, Francisco didn’t have any family.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: I didn’t have the heart to call Animal Control.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Jenny’s friend runs a rescue.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Or … we could keep him here at the precinct. I mean, we could use a mascot.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I thought that’s what you were.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That - What’s that? What’s that, buddy? Esposito’s sense of humor fell down a well and can’t get out? Please?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, fine. But only until we find him a suitable home.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Then you better find out what kind of food he eats, because he’s not touching the stuff I put out.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, there’s gotta be some food for him at Francisco’s place. Who wants to make a run for it?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: To go get dog food?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Castle.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ryan.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Esposito.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well. Shall we settle this like men?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: All right.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Mmm.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Two out of three?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Snip.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Dr. Barker, what kind of issues was he dealing with? Did he ever exhibit signs of paranoia?

utterance.speaker: BARKER
utterance.content: No. The occasional bout of depression, which then led to low self-esteem, which lead to binge eating.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: An eating problem? You wouldn’t know it to look at him.

utterance.speaker: BARKER
utterance.content: Oh, his diet was horrible. Oh, scraps from the garbage, dead birds, even his own feces.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: We’re not talking about Francisco, are we?

utterance.speaker: BARKER
utterance.content: Oh … you – you thought I was Francisco’s therapist? My patient is Royal.

utterance.speaker: BARKER
utterance.content: Well, I am a canine therapist. It’d be pretty crazy for me to treat people.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: People. That would be crazy.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Uh, Dr. Bark- Mrs. Barker, how did Francisco seem to you at Royal’s last appointment?

utterance.speaker: BARKER
utterance.content: Actually, he canceled it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Did he say why?

utterance.speaker: BARKER
utterance.content: Just that something had come up, then he had to be somewhere in a hurry.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, that’s … actually helpful.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, um… thank you. We’ll contact you if we need anything further.

utterance.speaker: BARKER
utterance.content: How is Royal doing? Is it true that he was at the crime scene? That he witnessed the murder?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: We think so, yes.

utterance.speaker: BARKER
utterance.content: There may be things he saw. Things he is trying to communicate about the crime. If you let me see him, I can try to find out what he knows.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You know, Francisco had a lot of faith in her. It might be worth a few minutes.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Of your time, sure.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’ll get him.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Beckett.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: I found enough dog food to keep Royal fat and happy for a while. Found something else tasty, too. Electronic bug sweeper. Looks new.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: To detect eavesdropping devices?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Uh huh. Paranoia or not, Francisco thought he was under surveillance.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, Francisco was worried that he was being bugged. Then yesterday, somewhere around 11AM, he runs off right around the time that Kay’s assistant said he started acting paranoid.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: And then a few hours later he’s murdered.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So then where the hell did he go?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: You know, we’ve got Francisco’s cell phone in evidence. If the GPS was turned on it might tell us exactly where he went.

utterance.speaker: BARKER
utterance.content: Yes, that’s right. I know. I know you are. Oh.

utterance.speaker: BARKER
utterance.content: The poor thing is just traumatized. How was he when you found him?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Uh, they said he was pawing at the ground. The man from Sunfair said that was a sign of bereavement?

utterance.speaker: BARKER
utterance.content: Royal. Royal, look at what I’m doing.

utterance.speaker: BARKER
utterance.content: That’s right. I know it is. He was trying to tell you something. Something important.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Really? You can tell all that from-

utterance.speaker: BARKER
utterance.content: Royal, look at me. I know. I know you’re hurt.

utterance.speaker: BARKER
utterance.content: You’re confused. You’re dealing with abandonment issues. There’s a lot to break through here. This could take some time.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Tell me, did Francisco ever observe you during your sessions?

utterance.speaker: BARKER
utterance.content: No. He waited outside. Why?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No reason.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: According to his phone, this is the place Francisco went yesterday before the dog show. Maybe it was to meet his gambling contacts.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Couldn’t he just do this over the phone?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Not if he was being bugged.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hmm.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Remember what else Francisco had in his pocket?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: What is this place?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It looks like some kind of a kennel.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah, I see the cages, but where are the …

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Shepherds.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Okay, listen. A friend of mine had one of these. They smell fear, so don’t flinch. Whatever you do, don’t –

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Run!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Ahhh!

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Go!

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Okay, okay.

utterance.speaker: JACK PATTERSON
utterance.content: What the hell are you doing in my warehouse?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Detectives Beckett and Esposito, NYPD.

utterance.speaker: PATTERSON
utterance.content: You got a warrant?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Who are you?

utterance.speaker: PATTERSON
utterance.content: Jack Patterson. I work for Francisco Pilar. Did anyway. What do you want?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We’re investigating his murder. What the hell is this place?

utterance.speaker: PATTERSON
utterance.content: Francisco was breeding a new type of dog. The Pilar Retriever. I managed the operation when he was travelling. It was a real tragedy. Guy spends his entire life developing a dog. He was almost ready to unveil it, too.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: How well did you know Francisco?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah, did he have a gambling hobby? Possibly took some bribes from the wrong people?

utterance.speaker: PATTERSON
utterance.content: Francisco didn’t have hobbies. His whole life was his work. And it was honest work.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah, well the thing is, Francisco made a bunch of major cash deposits into an account.

utterance.speaker: PATTERSON
utterance.content: Let me guess. Ten grand each, right? Word was leaking out about the Pilar Retriever. People were stopping Francisco at dog shows, giving him cash just to reserve a pup from the first litter.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Any idea why he rushed over here yesterday?

utterance.speaker: PATTERSON
utterance.content: Actually, yeah. He showed up with a bug detector, started sweeping the place.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Why would anyone want to put a kennel under surveillance?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I don’t know.

utterance.speaker: PATTERSON
utterance.content: Well, his breeding and training methods were closely guarded secrets. And the Pilar Retriever was making his competitors very nervous.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Anyone specific?

utterance.speaker: PATTERSON
utterance.content: It sounded crazy at the time. He thought one of his dog training clients was in business with someone who was trying to infiltrate our operation.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And did he tell you which client?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Kay Cappuccio? Why would she steal Francisco’s secrets?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We don’t know for sure that she did. In fact, we don’t actually know that he was bugged by anyone.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Well, we do now. Francisco’s sweeper has a memory and it tripped to a listening device yesterday morning.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: The same time he confronted Kay’s people and asked who she was working for. This can’t be a coincidence that all happened on the day he was killed.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
